alert.note: Alert for Lake; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 13 at 12:21PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Multiple Rounds of Soaking Rain with Localized Threat for Flooding This Afternoon through Saturday Morning... A strong fall weather system will bring periods of soaking rain to the area through Saturday morning. Repeated rounds of rain over the same area with limited time for runoff and infiltration into the soil may lead to localized flooding of low-lying and urban areas, as well as streams and creeks. This includes areas that already received 1 to 3 inches of rain on Wednesday. The main localized flooding threat area through early Saturday is for locations near and north of the Illinois and Kankakee Rivers. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible. Stay up to date on the latest forecasts including the possibility of flood watches, warnings, and advisories.
